info.title: Introduction
info.description:
Welcome to Trucker Path's API documentation. Integration partners can utilize our APIs to leverage Trucker Path's network of carriers for shipment needs. By accessing or using the Trucker Path API, you are agreeing to the Trucker Path Terms of Service. Need help? Email us at: integrations@truckerpath.com # Release Note 19/06/2023  Query Loads (pagination) now excludes deleted loads from the response
01/11/2022  Load postings now require mandatory long/lat for pickup and dropoff locations
31/10/2022  Fixes: Loads must have at least 2 stop_list
31/10/2022  Fixes: stop_list requires a pickup and a dropoff in sequence
19/10/2022  *Code Samples* for API request are now available
18/10/2022  Load Post APIs now require a mandatory *company_id* field
30/09/2022  Bug fixes
14/09/2022  Trucker Path API now allows you to manage Companies

tags.name: 0. Company maintainance
tags.description: In order to post your load, you must first set up at least ONE company. This is available via create company. You can also maintain your companies here with query/delete etc.

tags.name: 1. Loads APIs v2
tags.description: This API allows partners (broker, shipper, TMS) to post loads to Trucker Path's carrier network and define the allowed actions a carrier can take on that load.

tags.name: 3. Visibility APIs
tags.description: Track a freight shipment from a carrier using the Trucker Path navigation app.

tags.name: 4. WebHook Maintenance
tags.description: Highly configurable WebHooks are user-defined HTTP callbacks for actions happening in Truckloads. These can be used for event-based, real-time notifications between independent services. You can maintain your webhook url here.

tags.name: 5. WebHook Request Demo
tags.description: This is a request demo for Webhook. A post request like below will be sent to your specified callback url when bid/book action takes place. This is NOT an API for your application.

tags.name: 6. Load Offers
tags.description: To accept or reject a Bid/Book for your loads

post.description: You can have one web hook for each type of action. One for Bidding and one for Booking. You won't be able to create more than One webhook for each type of action.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/webhooks/add' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE' \
--header 'cache-control: <cache-control>' \
--data-raw '{
    "url":"https://go.takeleft.co/truckerpath?",
    "type":"BOOK"
}'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
   CURLOPT_URL => 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/webhooks/add',
   CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
   CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
   CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
   CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
   CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
   CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
   CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
   CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>'{
    "url":"https://go.takeleft.co/truckerpath?",
    "type":"BOOK"
}',
   CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
      'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
      'cache-control: <cache-control>'
   ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

post.description: Get a list of tracking items with filters.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/search' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "status": "ullamco",
    "page": 37,
    "page_size": 95
}'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
   CURLOPT_URL => 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/search',
   CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
   CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
   CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
   CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
   CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
   CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
   CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
   CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>'{
    "status": "ullamco",
    "page": 37,
    "page_size": 95
}',
   CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
      'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
      'Content-Type: application/json'
   ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

import requests
import json

url = "https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/search"

payload = json.dumps({
   "status": "ullamco",
   "page": 37,
   "page_size": 95
})
headers = {
   'Authorization': 'Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
   'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers, data=payload)

print(response.text)

post.description: Create a tracking with load information

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "carrier_name": "INIT",
    "carrier_phone": "09012345678",
    "carrier_email": "sample@test.com",
    "pick_up": {
        "state": "NY",
        "address": "New York, NY, USA",
        "city": "New York",
        "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
        "lat": 37.7576793,
        "lng": -122.5076399
    },
    "drop_off": {
        "state": "NY",
        "address": "New York, NY, USA",
        "city": "New York",
        "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
        "lat": 37.7576793,
        "lng": -122.5076399
    },
    "note": "Safe trip, Roger One",
    "shipper_notify_email": "shipper@test.com",
    "is_arrival_notified": true
}'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
   CURLOPT_URL => 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/',
   CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
   CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
   CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
   CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
   CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
   CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
   CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
   CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>'{
    "carrier_name": "INIT",
    "carrier_phone": "09012345678",
    "carrier_email": "sample@test.com",
    "pick_up": {
        "state": "NY",
        "address": "New York, NY, USA",
        "city": "New York",
        "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
        "lat": 37.7576793,
        "lng": -122.5076399
    },
    "drop_off": {
        "state": "NY",
        "address": "New York, NY, USA",
        "city": "New York",
        "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
        "lat": 37.7576793,
        "lng": -122.5076399
    },
    "note": "Safe trip, Roger One",
    "shipper_notify_email": "shipper@test.com",
    "is_arrival_notified": true
}',
   CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
      'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
      'Content-Type: application/json'
   ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

import requests
import json

url = "https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/tracking/"

payload = json.dumps({
   "carrier_name": "INIT",
   "carrier_phone": "09012345678",
   "carrier_email": "sample@test.com",
   "pick_up": {
      "state": "NY",
      "address": "New York, NY, USA",
      "city": "New York",
      "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
      "lat": 37.7576793,
      "lng": -122.5076399
   },
   "drop_off": {
      "state": "NY",
      "address": "New York, NY, USA",
      "city": "New York",
      "date_local": "2021-10-11T03:00:00",
      "lat": 37.7576793,
      "lng": -122.5076399
   },
   "note": "Safe trip, Roger One",
   "shipper_notify_email": "shipper@test.com",
   "is_arrival_notified": True
})
headers = {
   'Authorization': 'Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
   'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers, data=payload)

print(response.text)

post.description: Enable freight brokers and shippers to post their loads onto the Trucker Path network

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/shipments/v2' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
  "company_id": "string",
  "contact_info": {
    "contact_email": "howard@hhm.com",
    "contact_first_name": "Howard",
    "contact_last_name": "Hamlin",
    "contact_phone_number": "1234567890",
    "contact_phone_ext": "123"
  },
  "shipment_info": {
    "equipment": [
      "VAN"
    ],
    "load_size": "FULL",
    "description": "filing cabinets",
    "shipment_weight": 30000,
    "shipment_dimensions": {
      "shipment_height": 20,
      "shipment_width": 10,
      "shipment_length": 200
    },
    "requirements": "string",
    "stop_list": [
      {
        "stop_type": "pickup",
        "city": "Albuquerque",
        "state": "NM",
        "address_line": "6353 Juan Tabo Blvd",
        "zip": "123456",
        "country": "USA",
        "lat": 35.084250,
        "lng": -106.649240,
        "date_local": "2022-10-11T03:00:00",
        "sequence": 1,
        "stop_instruction": "1"
      },
     {
        "stop_type": "dropoff",
        "city": "Phoenix",
        "state": "AZ",
        "address_line": "6353 Juan Tabo Blvd",
        "zip": "123456",
        "country": "USA",
        "lat": 33.448376,
        "lng": -112.074036,
        "date_local": "2022-10-11T03:00:00",
        "sequence": 2,
        "stop_instruction": "1"
      }
    ],
    "shipment_price": 4500,
    "shipment_actions": {
      "biddable": true,
      "book_now": true,
      "link_url": "https://brokerload.com/loaddetail/12345"
    },
    "private_load": false,
    "external_id": "ba5bfcddab75490a946dc895025996a6"
  }
}'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
   CURLOPT_URL => 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/shipments/v2',
   CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
   CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
   CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
   CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
   CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
   CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
   CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
   CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>'{
  "company_id": "string",
  "contact_info": {
    "contact_email": "howard@hhm.com",
    "contact_first_name": "Howard",
    "contact_last_name": "Hamlin",
    "contact_phone_number": "1234567890",
    "contact_phone_ext": "123"
  },
  "shipment_info": {
    "equipment": [
      "VAN"
    ],
    "load_size": "FULL",
    "description": "filing cabinets",
    "shipment_weight": 30000,
    "shipment_dimensions": {
      "shipment_height": 20,
      "shipment_width": 10,
      "shipment_length": 200
    },
    "requirements": "string",
    "stop_list": [
      {
        "stop_type": "pickup",
        "city": "Albuquerque",
        "state": "NM",
        "address_line": "6353 Juan Tabo Blvd",
        "zip": "123456",
        "country": "USA",
        "lat": 35.084250,
        "lng": -106.649240,
        "date_local": "2022-10-11T03:00:00",
        "sequence": 1,
        "stop_instruction": "1"
      },
     {
        "stop_type": "dropoff",
        "city": "Phoenix",
        "state": "AZ",
        "address_line": "6353 Juan Tabo Blvd",
        "zip": "123456",
        "country": "USA",
        "lat": 33.448376,
        "lng": -112.074036,
        "date_local": "2022-10-11T03:00:00",
        "sequence": 2,
        "stop_instruction": "1"
      }
    ],
    "shipment_price": 4500,
    "shipment_actions": {
      "biddable": true,
      "book_now": true,
      "link_url": "https://brokerload.com/loaddetail/12345"
    },
    "private_load": false,
    "external_id": "ba5bfcddab75490a946dc895025996a6"
  }
}',
   CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
      'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
      'Content-Type: application/json'
   ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

         "shipment_width": 10,
         "shipment_length": 200
      },
      "requirements": "string",
      "stop_list": [

            "stop_type": "pickup",
            "city": "Albuquerque",
            "state": "NM",

            "country": "USA",

            "state": "AZ",

            "country": "USA",
            "lat": 33.448376,
            "lng": -112.074036,
            "date_local": "2022-10-11T03:00:00",
            "sequence": 2,
            "stop_instruction": "1"
         }
      ],
      "shipment_price": 4500,
      "shipment_actions": {
         "biddable": True,
         "book_now": True,
         "link_url": "https://brokerload.com/loaddetail/12345"
      },
      "private_load": False,
      "external_id": "ba5bfcddab75490a946dc895025996a6"
   }
})
headers = {
   'Authorization': 'Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
   'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers, data=payload)

print(response.text)

post.description: Update a previously posted load by external_id.

x-code-samples.source:

--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE' \

   'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
conn.request("POST", "/truckload/api/shipments/update/v2", payload, headers)
res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()
print(data.decode("utf-8"))

post.description: Enable partners to query active loads posted to the Trucker Path network.

<?php

   CURLOPT_URL => 'https://test-api.truckerpath.com/truckload/api/shipments/query/v2',
   CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
   CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
   CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
   CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
   CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
   CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
   CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
   CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>'{
"external_id": [
"3852B67D50"
]
}',
   CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
      'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..yj1-NT3kMie3Mg1ZTno2dhvUBEgiZJzXpyLl0i_rACE',
      'Content-Type: application/json'
   ),
));

url.description: A valid url expose to handle the webhook calls from truckerpath. a url should start with  https:// or http://, and should not have '?' or any query strings.

address.description: Specific address,eg New York, NY, USA

date_local.description: the pick-up or drop-off date & time, eg 2021-10-11T03:00:00

version.description:
Tracking versions.
- `version=0` or `1` means that Carrier tracking has been checked
- `version=2` For new tracking items, version=2, meaning to say that the Carrier has never logged in to App or Web once created
- `version=3` Carrier has not checked the tracking yet.

shipper_notify_email.description: Shipper's Email. A link of this tracking will be sent to this Email if not empty, so the shipper could track their loads.

is_arrival_notified.description: Whether to send notification once the load is delivered.

ContactInfo.description: Defines the individual (broker or shipper agent) handling a specific load

stop_list.description: Defines the stop location details of the load

shipment_price.description: price displayed to carriers in USD

private_load.description: Private loads are only visible for the carriers defined in the Carrier Whitelist Collect

ShipmentInfoExternal.description: Defines the load information displayed to Trucker Path carrier network

company_id.description: Company id where this load belongs to. Company ids are maintained within the Company APIs. if you don't specify this field, the load's broker will be by default the api account.

stop_type.description: Enum:`pickup` `dropoff`. This param only takes lowercase.

state.description: 2 letter abbreviation of USA state or canadian province

sequence.description: Stop sequence, starts with 1. Please make sure you have a unique sequence for each stop. Also, The stop with the smallest sequence must be pickup, and the stop with te biggest sequence must be dropoff.

stop_instruction.description: instructions for the driver or dispatcher

StoppingPoint.description: Defines the stop location details of the load

stop_list.description: Defines the stop location details of the load

shipment_price.description: price displayed to carriers in USD

private_load.description: Private loads are only visible for the carriers defined in the Carrier Whitelist Collect

ShipmentInfoExternalMust.description: Defines the load information displayed to Trucker Path carrier network

stop_list.description: Defines the stop location details of the load

private_load.description: Private loads are only visible for the carriers defined in the Carrier Whitelist Collect

private_load.description: Private loads are only visible for the carriers defined in the Carrier Whitelist Collect

QueryShipmentInfo.description: Defines the load information displayed to Trucker Path carrier network

company_id.description: Company id where this load belongs to. It's maintained within Company APIs. This field will be "default" if it was not specified when posting the load.

success.description: Whether the operation is successful or not

company_id.description: Carriers will be added under the company_id you defined in company_maintanence endpoint

company_email.description: company email.Please notice that companies under your account can't share an email with other companies. You should always have different email for each company.

success.description: Whether the operation is successful or not

msg.description: If Api responses a Non-success reply, this msg shows the failure detail.Else it will be blank.

Authorization.description:
For any partner to integrate with our APIs, you must reach out to Trucker Path's Integration team integration@truckerpath.com with the following information:
  - First and Last Name
  - Email
  - Company Name
  - Company Website
  - MC Number (if applicable)
  - USDOT Number (If applicable)
  - Trucker Path will generate a token for the
Afterwards, we will return you 2 things, which you can use to create a JWT
  - Issuer Identifier
  - Private RSA Key

### What is JWT?

Trucker Path API supports authentication with JWT. JSON Web Token is an open standard that is used to create access tokens cryptographically signed by the issuer so its integrity can be verified without an authentication server.

More information at https://jwt.io/

When interacting with Truckloads APIs, the JWT should be present as the bearer token in the Authorization header
